item.title: Trying To Understand Quantitative Easing
item.author: dajhub
item.description: This post looks at why Quantitative Easing (QE) is used by governments, how it works, and some of the criticisms levelled at QE. 1.0 The Bond Market & Interest Rates Before looking at quantitative easing it is helpful to have a basic knowledge of the relationship between bond prices and interest rates. Bonds have an inverse relationship to interest rates; when interest rates rise, bond prices fall, and vice-versa. Worked example:
